  This chapter examines the structure and theory of the firm under Islamic principles. We explore profit-sharing arrangements, worker rights and dignity, environmental stewardship, ethical production standards, and the prohibition of harmful goods. The Islamic firm is positioned as an entity with broader social responsibilities beyond profit maximization.
